div.sent: The Quran Majid is the message of Allah.
The Quran Majid gives us a guide line to do our work.
The language in which Quran Majid has been written is Arabic.
There are twenty nine letters in Arabic.
By knowing these letters we will be able to read the Quran Majid.
We shall learn to recite the Quran Majid and recite the Quran Majid every day.
Bangla is our mother tongue.
There are fifty letters in Bangla language.
Bangla is read from left side to the right.
Arabic is the language of the Quran Majid.
There are twenty nine letters in Arabic.
Arabic language is read from the right to the left.
In order to recognise Arabic letters easily English pronunciation of each alphabet has been given.
We shall learns the correct pronunciation of each arabic alphabet from our teacher.
There are one or more dots on or under Arabic letters.
These dots are called Nuqta.
In Arabic language some signs are used with letters.
These signs are known as Harkat or pronouncing signs.
There are three kinds of Harkat.
There are many letters in Arabic which does not have Jabor, Jer or Pesh.
But the previous letters have them.
A sign is used to pronounce the letter.
This sign is called Jazam.
Another name of Jazam is Sakin.

Many letters in Arabic language are pronounced twice.
A special sign is used for that purpose.
This sign is called Tashdeed.
The sign looks like this (W).
Tashdeed looks like the head of the letter .
A letter with Tashdeed is pronounced twice.
On the other hand many letters are to be read in long breath.
To read in long breath is called Madd.
There are three Madd letters.
